definition: to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on

sentences.english: He smiles when we express our adoration and gratitude to him.
sentences.chinese: 當我們崇拜仰慕他，他就歡喜。

sentences.english: I've never actually spoken to him - I've just admired him from afar.
sentences.chinese: 實際上我沒有跟他說過一句話，我只是遠遠地仰慕他。

sentences.english: His noble character and sterling integrity are admired by people.
sentences.chinese: 他的高風亮節爲人仰慕。

sentences.english: Master of Buddhism of which ten people were admired for a long time a big monk.
sentences.chinese: 其中佛教法師十人，都是仰慕已久的大和尚。

sentences.english: Which is why I have always purchased apple products and admired you.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼我一直購買蘋果產品和仰慕你的原因。

sentences.english: She had worshiped him for years…
The prince had appeared and subjugated the poor little handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 王子出現了，這使窮苦的小丫頭不勝仰慕。

sentences.english: I admire you for a long time.
There was a little cluster of admirers round the guest speaker.
sentences.chinese: 羣仰慕者圍着那位特邀嘉賓。

sentences.english: In the past a tribal native east of China really admired the rites of China.
sentences.chinese: 以前東方有個夷人，他很仰慕華夏文明的禮法。

sentences.english: Perhaps this is a sign that men are now looking for women they can admire and respect.
sentences.chinese: 也許這標誌着男性在尋找他們可以尊重和仰慕的女性。

sentences.english: All the ones I just named, but I have special admiration and respect for Bj0rk.
sentences.chinese: 所有的我都想說，但我最敬重仰慕的就是比約克了。

sentences.english: Winfrey also received messages from some less-famous admirers.
sentences.chinese: 溫弗瑞還收到了一些平民仰慕者的信息。

sentences.english: His one-time admirers now accuse him of being a turncoat.
sentences.chinese: 曾經一度仰慕他的人如今指責他是叛徒。

sentences.english: He claims to be an admirer of Byron.
sentences.chinese: 他宣稱是拜倫的仰慕者。

sentences.english: He seemed to enjoy the adoration of the mob at the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎很喜愛在動物園受到人們的仰慕。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to admire/to hold in high esteem
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
